definitions.definition: small pieces of rubbish such as paper, cans and bottles, that people have left lying in a public place

examples.text: There will be fines for people who **drop litter**.
Please do not leave litter after your picnic.
Pick up your litter and take it home with you.

definitions.definition: a number of things that are lying in an untidy way

examples.text: The floor was covered with a litter of newspapers, clothes and empty cups.

definitions.definition: a dry substance that is put in a shallow open box for pets, especially cats, to use as a toilet when they are indoors
definitions.labels: (also especially North American English)(British English)(North American English)

definitions.definition: a number of baby animals that one mother gives birth to at the same time

examples.text: the runt *(= the smallest and weakest baby)* of the litter
‘Chief’ was born six years ago, one of a litter of 11.

definitions.definition: the substance, especially straw, that is used for farm animals to sleep on
a kind of chair or bed that was used in the past for carrying important people

wordOrigin: Middle English (originally referring to a structure used to carry people carried on men's shoulders or by animals): from Old French litiere, from medieval Latin lectaria, from Latin lectus ‘bed’. Senses 1 and 2 date from the mid 18th cent.
